keyPolicies.policyDescription: Review all legislation and regulations from the EU to ensure competitiveness. Negotiate a bespoke trade agreement, tracking to mutual advantage. Withdraw from the European Free Trade Association to maintain a principle of free movement of labour. World Trade Organisation rules would be continued.
Increase personal allowance to the level of full-time minimum wage earnings (approx £13,500). Pursue a flat income tax band. Introduce a turnover tax for big businesses.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Reducing debts left to our grandchildren
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Leave the EU to save at least £8bn per annum in UK contributions. Limit foreign aid budget to £4bn annually.
Remove tuition fees for students taking approved degrees. Require immigrants to pay for state education for each child until they have paid National Insurance for five years.
Resource fully our military assets and personnel. Guarantee that no veteran is homeless.
Commit to spending £200m of the £2bn saved from EU contribution on the NHS.
Recognise the benefits of limited, controlled immigration. Work permits will be issued on a points-based system.
Limt foreign aid to genuine humanitarian assistance. Contracts for British organisations will be offered by removing the EU Procurement Directive.
Repeal the Climate Change Act 2008. Support the development of shale gas with proper safeguards.
Scrap HS2. Will only sign contracts for public roads and rail with British companies.
Protect the Green Belt. Planning rules in the NPPF will be changed to make it easier to build on brownfield sites.
Leave the Common Agricultural Policy. Establish a British Fishery Protection Squadron.
Have only English MPs vote on laws of England. Introduce the Citizens' Initiative to allow petition to repeal legislation.
Ensure all public signs are in English and, where appropriate Welsh and Scots Gaelic. Recognise the cultural importance of historic counties.
Oppose the application of the EU Temporary Agency Workers Directive. Require the Agency Workers Directive to respect UK law.

issues.brexitEurope: Leave the EU to save at least £8bn per annum in UK contributions.
issues.economy: Will ensure economic prosperity by increasing personal allowance and introducing a turnover tax for big businesses.
issues.education: Remove tuition fees for students taking approved degrees. Require immigrants to pay for state education for each child until they have paid National Insurance for five years.
issues.governance: Limit foreign aid to £4bn annually. Ensure British organisations are offered contracts by removing the EU Procurement Directive.
issues.health: Commit £200m of the £2bn saved from EU contributions to the NHS.
issues.immigration: Recognise the benefits of controlled immigration. Issue work permits based on a points-based system.

housing.content: Protect the Green Belt. Change planning rules to make it easier to build on brownfield sites.
